what: SahelGraphR Accelerates the Production of Sahel ASP RCT Graphs and Tables
title: SahelGraphR Accelerates the Production of Sahel ASP RCT Graphs and Tables
text: SahelGraphR package aimed providing functions speed production graphs (maybe tables future?) Sahel ASP RCT evaluation DIME.

title: SahelGraphR Accelerates the Production of Sahel ASP RCT Graphs and Tables
text: can install development version SahelGraphR GitHub :

title: SahelGraphR Accelerates the Production of Sahel ASP RCT Graphs and Tables
text: package contains two themes production ggplot2 graphs Sahel ASP graphs.

title: SahelGraphR Accelerates the Production of Sahel ASP RCT Graphs and Tables
text: example graph using dark theme:
code: library(SahelGraphR) ## basic example code library(ggplot2)   # Prepare data cty_mpg <-   aggregate(mpg$cty, by = list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN = mean)  # aggregate colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage")  # change column names cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage),]  # sort cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make) # Plot ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x = make, y = mileage)) +   geom_segment(aes(     x = make,     xend = make,     y = 0,     yend = mileage   ), color = "white") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = SahelGraphR::asp_palettes$Dark[["yellow-full"]]) +   labs(title = "Lollipop Chart",        subtitle = "Make Vs Avg. Mileage",        caption = "source: mpg") +   SahelGraphR::themeaspdark() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 65, vjust = 0.6))

title: SahelGraphR Accelerates the Production of Sahel ASP RCT Graphs and Tables
text: example graph using light theme:
code: library(SahelGraphR) ## basic example code library(ggplot2)   # Prepare data cty_mpg <-   aggregate(mpg$cty, by = list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN = mean)  # aggregate colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage")  # change column names cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage),]  # sort cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make) # Plot ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x = make, y = mileage)) +   geom_segment(aes(     x = make,     xend = make,     y = 0,     yend = mileage   ), color = "#4c4d4c") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = SahelGraphR::asp_palettes$Light[["anthracite-full"]]) +   labs(title = "Lollipop Chart",        subtitle = "Make Vs Avg. Mileage",        caption = "source: mpg") +   SahelGraphR::themeasplight() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 65, vjust = 0.6))

what: A palette generator for the Sahel Adaptive Social Protection RCT — asp_palette
title: A palette generator for the Sahel Adaptive Social Protection RCT — asp_palette
text: color palettes useful production graphs Sahel ASP RCT program. function calls one two official palettes asp_palette: one dark theme one light theme.

title: A palette generator for the Sahel Adaptive Social Protection RCT — asp_palette
A palette generator for the Sahel Adaptive Social Protection RCT — asp_palette
text: Adapted https://github.com/karthik/wesanderson/blob/master/R/colors.R

title: A palette generator for the Sahel Adaptive Social Protection RCT — asp_palette
text: name Name desired palette. Current choices : IHEID, Centres, SDGs. n Number colors desired. omitted, uses colors. type Either "continuous" "discrete". Use continuous want automatically interpolate colors.

title: A palette generator for the Sahel Adaptive Social Protection RCT — asp_palette
text: vector colors.

title: A palette generator for the Sahel Adaptive Social Protection RCT — asp_palette
code: asp_palette("Dark")  asp_palette("Light")   # If you need more colors than normally found in a palette, you # can use a continuous palette to interpolate between existing # colors pal <- asp_palette(21, name = "Dark", type = "continuous") image(volcano, col = pal)

title: Complete list of palettes — asp_palettes
text: Use asp_palette construct palettes desired length.

title: Complete list of palettes — asp_palettes
Complete list of palettes — asp_palettes
text: object class list length 2.

text: Theme ggplot graphs accordance Bernie's blog colors.

title:
Dark theme for {ggplot2} graphs. Inspired by the excellent
{hrbrthemes} package. — themeaspdark
code: # \donttest{  library(ggplot2)  # Prepare data  cty_mpg <- aggregate(mpg$cty, by=list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN=mean)  # aggregate  colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage")  # change column names  cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage), ]  # sort  cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make)  # Plot  ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x=make, y=mileage)) +    geom_segment(aes(x=make,                     xend=make,                     y=0,                     yend=mileage), color = "white") +    geom_point(size=3, color = SahelGraphR::asp_palettes$Dark[["yellow-full"]]) +    labs(title="Lollipop Chart",         subtitle="Make Vs Avg. Mileage",         caption="source: mpg") +    SahelGraphR::themeaspdark() +    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=65, vjust=0.6))   # }

title: Light theme for {ggplot2} graphs — themeasplight
code: # \donttest{  library(ggplot2)  # Prepare data  cty_mpg <- aggregate(mpg$cty, by=list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN=mean)  # aggregate  colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage")  # change column names  cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage), ]  # sort  cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make)  # Plot  ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x=make, y=mileage)) +    geom_segment(aes(x=make,                     xend=make,                     y=0,                     yend=mileage), color = "#C3CED6") +    geom_point(size=3, color = "#C3CED6") +    labs(title="Lollipop Chart",         subtitle="Make Vs Avg. Mileage",         caption="source: mpg") +    SahelGraphR::themeaspdark() +    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=65, vjust=0.6))   # }

title: SahelGraphR 0.0.0.9000
text: Initialized package. Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added ASP color palettes continuous color generator. Added ASP ggplot2 themes light dark graphs.
